column2:
I grew up in a household where DV was the norm (rather than an occasional aberration). The way that monster talks on those recordings, not just what she says, but how she says it... She's not a survivor, she's a perpetrator. Hearing those recordings, threw me right back into my childhood.
She has no right to speak on behalf of anyone... Let alone those who have survived behaviour exactly like her own recorded actions. That's just sick. Playing the victim & claiming solidarity with those who've had to live with the consequences of the actions of the genuinely abused... Is a real gut-punch. That's like having to imagine my mother's 2nd (but just as nasty, angry & violent as her 1st) husband claim that it was he who was stood in the bathtub & beaten (for getting lost having gotten turned around & walking the wrong way when getting off the school bus, on their first day, in a new place, in a new country). It's like having to suffer that all over again.

Whilst the actual victim(s) in this, are either still too in her thrall, or still too scared to speak out, as one of their number (JD), has the life & career he has cultivated, nurtured & grown for decades (which frankly, was likely all that attracted this monster to him... The fame, money & status she wanted for herself, & was upset to not just be 'given' by virtue of having married him), is systematically taken away from him.
He's already had 2 iconic roles pulled out from under him & it's likely that the only reason the tabloids aren't openly mocking him... Is cos that would mean acknowledging they got it wrong, that it was the 'tiny, little woman', rather than the 'big, strong, brute of a man' who was the bad guy. Shame on all of them.

JD, I stand with you & I applaud your bravery in not just surviving this & not just weathering the loss of your reputation & livelihood, but for being brave enough to admit that you fell victim to a domestic abuser. That takes some guts.
